Dear BREANNA NELSON:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/24/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Rorie Dodge-Pifer, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4147 Dental care
(2) A dental examination within 12 months prior to
admission shall be documented or there shall be an
examination not later than 90 calendar days following
admission.
1 of 3 youth files reviewed did not have a timely dental. Youth A was admitted on
10/5/22 but his first dental on record was 3/13/23.
CCI Rule 400.4119 Social service worker; qualifications.

(1) A social service worker, at the time of appointment
to the position, shall possess a bachelor’s degree with
a major in a human behavioral science from an
accredited college or university or another major with
25% of credits in human behavioral sciences.
The social service worker hired did not have a degree in a human behavioral
science or another major with 25% of credits in human behavioral sciences.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
Budget and audit were reviewed. No concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The facility continues to work on hiring additional direct care staff. They also
continue to have their program Quality Team review all CAPs, rules and policies to
ensure compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One staff interviewed indicated she was not happy with the lack of direct care staff
and having to cover shifts that she does not usually work. The supervisor and
administrator both indicated things are getting better as they hire additional staff.

All youth interviewed are happy to be at the facility and they did not have any
concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
During the walk through of the facility all bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, common
areas and medication storage was viewed. All areas were clean and organized. No
safety concerns were viewed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
